result.execSummary:
The defendant Julian D. Elizondo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during the period of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Julian D. Elizondo in court with attorney Paul Douglas Polacek. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:50 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

State files Amended Information.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1 & 2 of the amended information - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  Atty Cousins makes statements re: victim notification. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2 of the amended information.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Polacek makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CF394 Count 1 - 
Imposed & Stayed - 60 days jail
2 days credit
Placed on probation for a period of 18 months:
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate.

14CF394 Count 2 -
Imposed & Stayed - 60 days jail, concurrent with Count 1
Placed on probation for a period of 18 months probation, concurrent:
Comply with conditions in Count 1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during the period of probation.
(Code only - Amended Information was filed)

Pre-trial conference at 04-13-2015 11:00 am
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 23, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Julian D. Elizondo in court with attorney Paul Douglas Polacek. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

Stands Mute.  Court enters NOT GUILTY Plea on defendant's behalf.

Bond Continued.

Atty Polacek makes statements regarding phone contact with the victim. 
Atty Constable makes statements.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 11:30 am.
See adjourned initial appearance for minutes.
Preliminary hearing on January 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Julian D. Elizondo in court with attorney Paul Douglas Polacek. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits are waived for preliminary hearing.
Atty Polacek request amended bond to allow no abusive contact with consent of the child via telephone or text.
ADA Knaapen states objections as bond already states the child can file a family safety plan.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Physical Abuse to a Child.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant does not qualify for a public defender. He is self employed as a mason/contractor.
State requests a $ with conditions as stated.
